content.raw:
Can you elaborate a little on the plan for the "asynchronous" clocking scheme?
I would imagine that you would want to set up the clock/trigger line such that falling edges happened 100us before the times at which you ask the DDS output to change, assuming that it is a repeatable 100us delay, or at very least have the falling edges occur at the update times and know that there will be some uncertainty in that device, so not use it for timing critical things.
Your commit message makes it sound like you will still have the clock line rise at the update time, then fall as soon as possible, leading to the DDS updating some time later depending on the high time and the Novatech's pipeline delay.

See also [issue 8 on the labscript repo](#!/labscript_suite/labscript/issue/8/asymmetric-clock-pulses) and [my blog post](http://labscriptsuite.org/blog/implementation-of-the-novatech-dds9m/) about Novatech programming for details on how asymmetric pulses will benefit the "synchronous" programming scheme too!
